projects.title: Bayesian Linear Regressions
projects.description: Implementing and understanding Bayesian Linear Regressions using JAX. In this post I derive the Maximum Likelihood Estimator (MLE), the Maximum A Posteriori (MAP) considering a Gaussian and Laplace prior (Deriving L1 and L2 regularisation).

projects.title: Principal Component Analysis (PCA)
projects.description: Implementing PCA using the MNIST dataset.

projects.title: Logistic Regression
projects.description: Implementing Logistic Regression using PyTorch. In this post I use a PCA to reduce dimensionality and colinearity and then implement a simple logistic regression using the breast cancer dataset from Wisconsin.

projects.title: NLP on Electronic Health Records (EHR)
projects.description: Extract insights from unstructured clinical notes using Natural Language Processing techniques. This project includes text cleaning, embedding generation (e.g., using word2vec or BERT), and basic classification to predict patient outcomes or flag critical cases.

projects.title: Anomaly Detection in Patient Vital Signs
projects.description: Detect anomalies in patient vital signs data using unsupervised methods (e.g., Isolation Forest or Autoencoders). This notebook simulates real-time monitoring scenarios to spot early signs of deterioration.

projects.title: Medical Image Classification using Transfer Learning
projects.description: Leverage pre-trained convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to classify medical images (e.g., chest X-rays or dermatology images). This notebook walks through fine-tuning a model to identify key pathologies while explaining the challenges of limited labeled data.

projects.title: Explainable AI in Healthcare
projects.description: Implement techniques such as SHAP or LIME to explain predictions made by a black-box model on a healthcare dataset. This project emphasizes model interpretability, which is crucial in clinical settings for gaining trust from medical professionals.
